Logging and error handlingÂ¶

group asmjit_logging

Contains classes related to loging. Currently logging is implemented in asmjit::BaseLogger class. The function asmjit::BaseLogger::log() can be overridden to redirect logging into any user-defined stream.

To log your assembler output to FILE stream use this code:

 // Create assembler
 Assembler a;

 // Create and set file based logger
 FileLogger logger(stderr);
 a.setLogger(&logger);

You can see that logging goes through Assembler. If you are using Compiler and you want to log messages in correct assembler order, you should look at Compiler::comment() method. It allows you to insert text message into items stream so the Compiler is able to send messages to Assembler in correct order.

See
asmjit::BaseLogger, asmjit::FileLogger.

Enums

kLoggerOption enum

Logger options.

Values:

  • kLoggerOptionBinaryForm = 0 -

    Whether to output instructions also in binary form.

  • kLoggerOptionHexImmediate = 1 -

    Whether to output immediates as hexadecimal numbers.

  • kLoggerOptionHexDisplacement = 2 -

    Whether to output displacements as hexadecimal numbers.

  • kLoggerOptionCount = 3 -

    Count of logger options.

kLoggerStyle enum

Values:

  • kLoggerStyleDefault = 0 -
  • kLoggerStyleDirective = 1 -
  • kLoggerStyleLabel = 2 -
  • kLoggerStyleData = 3 -
  • kLoggerStyleComment = 4 -
  • kLoggerStyleCount = 5 -

class BaseLogger

Abstract logging class.

This class can be inherited and reimplemented to fit into your logging subsystem. When reimplementing use asmjit::Logger::log() method to log into your stream.

This class also contain _enabled member that can be used to enable or disable logging.

Public Functions

ASMJIT_API BaseLogger()

Create a BaseLogger instance.

ASMJIT_API ~BaseLogger()

Destroy the BaseLogger instance.

void logString(uint32_t style, const char * buf, size_t len = kInvalidIndex)

Abstract method to log output.

Default implementation that is in asmjit::Logger is to do nothing. It’s virtual to fit to your logging system.

ASMJIT_API void logFormat(uint32_t style, const char * fmt, ...)

Log formatter message (like sprintf) sending output to logString() method.

ASMJIT_API void logBinary(uint32_t style, const void * data, size_t size)

Log binary data.

uint32_t getOptions()

Get all logger options as a single integer.

bool getOption(uint32_t id)

Get the given logger option.

ASMJIT_API void setOption(uint32_t id, bool value)

Set the given logger option.

const char * getIndentation()

Get indentation.

ASMJIT_API void setIndentation(const char * indentation)

Set indentation.

void resetIndentation()

Reset indentation.

Public Members

uint32_t _options

Options, see kLoggerOption.

char _indentation[12]

Indentation.

Private Functions

BaseLogger(const BaseLogger & other)

BaseLogger & operator=(const BaseLogger & other)

class FileLogger

Logger that can log to standard C FILE* stream.

Public Functions

ASMJIT_API FileLogger(FILE * stream = NULL)

Create a new FileLogger.

Parameters
  • stream -

    FILE stream where logging will be sent (can be NULL to disable logging).

ASMJIT_API ~FileLogger()

Destroy the FileLogger.

FILE * getStream()

Get FILE* stream.

Note
Return value can be NULL.

ASMJIT_API void setStream(FILE * stream)

Set FILE* stream.

Set file stream.

Parameters
  • stream -

    FILE stream where to log output (can be NULL to disable logging).

ASMJIT_API void logString(uint32_t style, const char * buf, size_t len = kInvalidIndex)

Abstract method to log output.

Default implementation that is in asmjit::Logger is to do nothing. It’s virtual to fit to your logging system.

Public Members

FILE * _stream

C file stream.

Private Functions

FileLogger(const FileLogger & other)

FileLogger & operator=(const FileLogger & other)

class StringLogger

String logger.

Public Functions

ASMJIT_API StringLogger()

Create new StringLogger.

ASMJIT_API ~StringLogger()

Destroy the StringLogger.

const char * getString()

Get char* pointer which represents the resulting string.

The pointer is owned by StringLogger, it can’t be modified or freed.

void clearString()

Clear the resulting string.

ASMJIT_API void logString(uint32_t style, const char * buf, size_t len = kInvalidIndex)

Abstract method to log output.

Default implementation that is in asmjit::Logger is to do nothing. It’s virtual to fit to your logging system.

Public Members

StringBuilder _stringBuilder

Output.
